description:
Billions have been spent on Nick Fury's gloal security force, but the public is starting to complain because there's no huge threat for them to battle! Meanwhile, friction breaks out between the members when The Ultimates movie is optioned!

Space/New York City

Tony Stark is in space with Shannon Elizabeth and having an interview with Larry King back in New York City. Things are not going well with the justification of the team. Billions have been spent and the team isn't even formed.

Also in New York Steve Rogers buys a new wardrobe for the new time he is in but when he gets back to his own apartment he finds he has been robbed. This means Giant Man is the only one at Betty Ross' In her anger she really comes down hard on Bruce Banner and his failures with the Super Soldier formula.

Norway

Later, Nick Fury and Banner try to recruit Thor for their team. Thor is having none of it and gets the better of Banner. He even tells everyone that Banner cries himself to sleep over Betty. Comply dejected they leave Thor.

New York

Weeks later, back in New York the team joke around about who would play them in a movie. They tease each other, and even joke about Banner who happens to walk in and hear them. this is the last straw for Banner so he injects himself with the Super Soldier Formula and the Hulk Serum.

He then calls Betty to warn her of what he has done. Later, believing Banner is having a heart attack an ambulance team tries to help Banner only to be the first victims of the Hulk's new rage. Back at the base the team assembles to stop one of their own.
name: Thunder

description: When The Ultimates leap into the fire, injuries abound, things don't quite go as they're planned, and the squad learns what it means to do the most dangerous job in the world! The dynamic duo of Mark Millar and Bryan Hitch promise to take it to a whole new level in this one!
name: Hulk Does Manhattan

description:
One of Tony Starks many competitors seek to put an end to the Iron Man's fame. To prove that the Iron Man suite is nothing but a pile of mechanical junk, Drexel Cord will build a bigger and more destructive suite! Enter the Demolisher!

A competitor of Tony Stark's, Drexel Cord, is convinced Stark is more successful because of Iron Man so he builds the Demolisher to destroy the Avenger. Cords daughter however, doesn't agree with her father and goes to warn Iron Man. The Demolisher finds Tony Stark on his private yacht and attacks. Forcing Stark to put on his armor and fight. The Demolisher quickly set his sights on the golden avenger and the fight begins.

Meanwhile Janice Cord has gotten to the Stark Industries plant and meets Jasper Sitwell who takes her with him to get to the Demolisher's master controls. When they get to Drexel Cords lab, a medieval castle, the Demolisher has knocked Iron Man out by keeping him under water and is on his way back to the lab.

Sitwell and Janice break into the lab but Drexel Cord activates the auto-destruct so they won't stop his creation. Luckily Iron Man is still conscious as it seems the auto-destruct destroyed something in the Demolisher robot itself causing it to attack anything in its way, even Cords daughter. Iron Man finally defeats the Demolisher by attacking the Demolisher's insides through an open plate on its back after Drexel Cord distracts the robot, at the cost of his life.
name: The Day Of The Demolisher!

description:
It's the big Premiere! The Invincible Iron Man versus the menaces of Whiplash and AIM. Featuring Nick Fury and SHIELD.

Alone Against A.I.M.!

ISSUE #1 OF IRON MAN’S 1ST SOLO SERIES!

Continues from Iron Man and Sub-Mariner #1.

Iron Man is captured by A.I.M using a suction beam and trapped in a submarine by orders of Mordius. Meanwhile A.I.M. soldiers are gloating about how they have sunk The Maggia’s gambling ship and destroyed their leadership. The Golden Avenger is knocked out by gas while back on the sinking Maggia ship Jasper Sitwell is evacuating the passengers. Sitwell stumbles upon Whitney Frost whom he recognises from Stark Industries as one of Tony’s admirers. Sitwell rescues Frost and they are taken aboard a S.H.I.E.L.D. helicopter where Nick Fury awaits. When alone Frost reveals herself to be The Big M, leader of The Maggia, and her plan to use Sitwell to learn the secrets of Stark Industries.

Elsewhere Iron Man is brought to A.I.M.’s secret island headquarters for Mordius to experiment on. Mordius is vying to become the new leader of A.I.M. and thinks defeating Iron Man and copying his armour will allow him to do this. Iron Man is strapped in an X-ray photo chamber where the secrets of his armour are copied and duplicates made instantly in another machine. 3 replica Iron Man suits are made for Mordius’ henchmen but as soon as they put these on Iron Man breaks free! The oxygen supply in his suit had kept him conscious all this time and he was faking to learn A.I.M.'s plans. Immediately the hero destroys the duplicating machine preventing Mordius from creating further copies. Now the Golden Avenger finds himself trapped inside A.I.M.’s headquarters where he must battle a trio of Iron Men!

Unfortunately for Modius his henchmen aren't able to control the powers within the suit and start inadvertently destroying his lab. Thus the Iron Henchmen attack on foot but Stark's superior skill soon allows him to overwhelm the trio. The battle causes a fire in the lab and in the confusion Mordius manages to fire a rocket cannon at the four men of iron, willingly destroying his loyal men to kill Iron Man. However the real Avenger escapes the explosion by ducking in the generator room where he manages to reroute the circuits. Iron Man escapes as the alarm sounds and due to his tampering, when Mordius attempts to fix the generators he causes a critical overload thus blowing himself and the entire island to oblivion!

The Origin of Iron Man

A retelling of Iron Man's origin from Tales of Suspense #39.

In March 1963, within a secluded section of the U.S. defense perimeter in Vietnam, billionaire weapons manufacturer Tony Stark is assisting the war effort by unveiling his new miniature transistor powered technologies to the U.S. Forces. As fate would have it, while walking towards the test site for his new inventions Stark sets off a tripwire and the explosion leaves Stark fatally injured when a shrapnel pierces his heart. Stark is then kidnapped by the red tyrant Wong-Chu, who forces Tony to spend his last days building weapons for his Communist army.

The dying inventor is imprisoned with famous Chinese doctor Ho Yinsen and instead of building weapons for the red terrorists the two begin working on an iron suit that will not only extend Tony's life, but also perform amazing feats of power allowing the captives to escape. While the two inventors are charging the iron suit for its first use, Wong-Chu's guards go to check on their captives and Yinsen sacrifices his life by distracting the guards to buy Stark more time. The ploy is successful and Tony Stark dons the suit to become The Invincible Iron Man.
name: Alone Against A.I.M.!

description:
In the aftermath of his battle with the Demolisher, Tony Stark race against the clock to create a new suite complete with a new lasting battery to keep his heart from failing. But things get extremely complicated when the Freak appears.

The Issue begins with Iron Man saving some workers at the Uranus-12 Rocket construction site when there´s an accident and the rocket starts falling. Unfortunatly he overworks his armor, with its power levels already low from fighting the Demolisher, and his heart starts bothering him again.

He makes it to his office, ignoring Jasper Sitwell and Whitney Frost waiting in the hall, but once there he discovers he cannot disconnect the recharge cable as his heart is weaker then ever. To counter this Tony draws the blueprints for revisions to his armor, and then has Happy Hogan construct the new armor.

In the final stage of the construction, Happy overworks a Cobalt bombarder as he wants to hurry it up, as Tony´s chestplate is giving out due to overcharging. The bombarder explodes, bathing Happy in its energy, causing him to slowly change into the Freak. His transformation completes as he puts the new armor on an unconcsious Tony, who wakes up to see his friend change.

The Freak breaks through a wall, taking Pepper Potts with him. Iron Man catches up with the Freak atop a partially constructed building, where he has to defeat him so an Enervation Intensifier can be used to turn him back to Happy Hogan.

Finally The Freak is lured into a van where he is gassed unconscious and carried off to be treated.
name: My Friend, My Foe...The Freak!

description:
It's one disaster after another! After reverting Happy Hogan back to his normal self, Tony Stark must face the Unicorn! Can the Invincible Iron Man defeat the Unicorn and his deadly horn?

Unconquered Is The Unicorn!

The issue begins with Tony Stark trying to revert The Freak back to Happy Hogan. Pepper Potts is aiding her boss in the process and prays that Happy will be alright. Her prayers come true as the process is successful and before their eyes The Freak transforms back to Happy Hogan. Meanwhile somewhere behind the Iron Curtain an almost reverse experiment is happening where Communist scientists are attempting to induce super strength into a brainwashed traitor. Using a Hyper-Activator, the subject is being placed in a permanent condition of enhanced strength and power but at the cost of a shortened life span. Thus The Unicorn is reborn. The scientists want to run tests but The Unicorn proves his strength by destroying a solid steel platform with his bare hands. The Unicorn is given his new improved uniform and immediately turns on his communist masters. It turns out the Hyper-Activator used to give him super strength also eroded the effects of the brainwashing. The Unicorn destroys the machine that gave him power so it can’t be used again and using his built in rockets flies away in search of someone who can reverse the life shortening effect of his new power.

Back at Stark Industries a cured Happy Hogan and a relieved Pepper Potts take their leave of a weary Tony Stark. Lost in his own thoughts Stark wonders whether being Iron Man is worth the tragedy it brings to his friends. Stark’s secretary Miss Greer reminds him of a scientific congress he is scheduled to appoint and again Stark wonders whether being The Golden Avenger is worth hindering the good work of Tony Stark. Meantime the news of the congress reaches the ears of The Unicorn in his secret European base where he decides one of the world renowned scientists attending must be able to cure him of life shortening illness… and those who can’t will be held hostage for ransom from their governments. The Congress gathers in an Alpine lodge and the world’s TV cameras are present. Tony Stark contemplates telling his secret to the world as he considers if one man can bare such a burden. But while Stark ponders the dilemma of his dual identity The Unicorn takes control of all the cameras in the conference room and bursts in through the roof. Unicorn’s plan is to televise his power to the world. First he seals the doors with a heat beam from his Unicorn’s Horn, then after protecting himself from the guards’ bullets with a force field he knocks them out with a stun ray. Finally he demolishes a stage with the full force of his beams.

The Unicorn turns to the cameras to make his ransom demands and we find out that Tony Stark was caught in the earlier blast. Stark was saved by his protective chest plate but the indestructible attaché case containing his armour was blown away from him and is lying near The Unicorn’s feet. Stark inches forward along the floor while Unicorn has his back turned making his demands. But the Hyper-Activator’s heightening effects have sharpened all The Unicorn’s senses including his hearing and he blasts Stark with a beam from his horn. Stark managed to jump away in time but the blast radius was enough to send him flying, making his body numb. Not giving up, the tenacious millionaire tries his luck again but once more his foe spots him and another blast follows. Unicorn makes an example of Stark in front of the cameras telling the world this is what will happen to any who defy him. Meantime Stark makes a desperate last lunge and reaches his attaché case. Once again he is seen and blasted by The Unicorn who uses a stronger beam this time, sending the playboy industrialist hurtling across the room. Stark is knocked out by the blast and Unicorn resumes addressing the camera. Moments later when the hero awakens, he uses the surrounding debris as cover to finally change into Iron Man.

Iron Man uses his power jets to streak full force at his foe, knocking both of them through a wall and onto the snowy mountain outside. This creates a hole for the kidnaped victims to escape. The Unicorn reveals he needs the scientists to find a cure for his life shortening illness and blasts The Golden Avenger with his horn. Iron Man steadies himself with his jets and uses his repulsors to stagger the villain while deciding in his mind that he must take full responsibility over the powers of Iron Man lest someone irresponsible like The Unicorn takes advantage. The hero attempts to negotiate The Unicorn’s surrender in exchange for helping him find a cure but the power mad villain refuses to give up his new found strength and sends another blast at Iron Man.

The super powered duo continue their battle on the mountain top until Iron Man is pinned down on the edge of a drop and The Unicorn sits on top of his foe continuing to blast him at point blank range. Iron Man withstands the blasts and rips Unicorn’s power belt away from his waist, crushing it in the process. This takes away the use of Unicorn’s blasts and force field leaving him with only his super strength. Iron Man tells tosses the belt down the cliff telling Unicorn again to submit. However the crazed villain dives after his belt jumping to his certain doom. Iron Man goes after him not knowing if Unicorn’s rockets still work without the power belt, but he finds nothing. Whilst returning back to the lodge the hero decides Tony Stark must carry the burden of being Iron Man alone.
name: Unconquered Is the Unicorn!

description:
Tony Stark is kidnapped into by a time-traveling soldier and brought to the future to be executed for a crime he has yet to create. Can the unarmed playboy convince the High Council that he is innocent?

An unarmored Tony Stark is kidnapped by time-traveling soldiers from the future and brought forward in time to be executed for a crime he has yet to commit. Stark is charged with mass murder by creating the super computer Cerberus which rules the world through an army of mindless humaniods and robot servants. Spared only by the intervention of Cerberus’s forces seeking to crush the rebels, Tony and a rebel named Krylla escape from the overrun lair. Krylla turns out to have not been set on the plan of killing Tony and as a historian herself takes him to a museum where she learned about his role in creating the now present future. There Tony is able to turn into Iron Man as he discovers a relic suit of armor of his now on display. Alerted by the energy of the Armor, Cerberus sends robots to defeat Iron Man. The Golden Avenger and Krylla escape and head towards Cerebrus' lair only to face a massive manifestation of the computer that combats with Iron Man. The computer however is forced into a loop of contradiction leading to an overload when it is revealed that its creator Tony Stark is under the helmet. Cerebrus cannot put self preservation over protecting its creator and Krylla uses this opportunity to blow up its master computer banks, terminating Cerebrus.
name: Frenzy in a Far-Flung Future!

description:
Iron Man finds himself in a fight to the death when the Crusher cries vengeance!

Having freed himself from the center of the Earth, the Crusher attacks an outpost of one of his former masters in order to steal a boat to travel to the United States to get revenge on Iron Man. While in the States, Tony Stark tries to console Janice Cord by sending her flowers. As the Crusher travels to America, he informs his prisoners how he managed to survive being sucked to the Earth's core: While there, he was returned back to his human form where he stumbled upon the lair of Tyrannus and used his devices to restore his powers.

While back in the States, Iron Man tests out a new battering ram under the supervision of Jasper Sitwell. While at Maggia headquarters Whitney Frost deals with insubordination from her men who question her leadership in light of an attempt to steal Stark's latest invention, Frost decides to take matters into her own hands, using Sitwell as her pawn.

When the Crusher attacks Stark Industries, Whitney enters the building to try and steal one of Stark's super-weapons. When Whitney is captured by the Crusher, Jasper tries to save her forcing Iron Man to knock Sitwell out so that he can deal with the Crusher without anyone getting hurt. Using the centrifugal force device he uses it to make the Crusher weightless and carry his foe over the ocean and drop him there, where his massive bulk causes him to sink to the ocean's floor. Returning to Stark International, Iron Man finds a revived Jasper humiliated that Iron Man saved Whitney from the Crusher, and the dejected Sitwell leaves to "prove" himself to Whitney.
name: Vengeance... Cries The Crusher!

description:
Iron Man's back is against the ropes, as he finds himself at the mercy of the Gladiator's whirling blades. Can Tony Stark save his friends from certain death? Find out when the Maggia strikes!

Training for a raid of Stark Enterprises, Whitney Frost has her goons practice their attack with the help of their newest recruit, the costumed villain known as the Gladiator. However, Frost is not convinced that Gladiator can succeed given his past track record, however the Gladiator assures her that his failure against Daredevil was due to his choice in allies, not because of his inability to stop his foe. Not wishing Jasper Sitwell to be harmed, Frost travels to Stark Enterprises to pick him up.

Stark meanwhile has a meeting with Janice Cord and her lawyer Vincent Sandhurst who have come to sell her father's assets to Tony. Traveling to Drexel Cord's old lab, the trio are captured by Gladiator and the Maggia and taken to their base, where Tony learns that Whitney is the Maggia's leader Big M. Faking a heart attack in order to get a hold of his brief case, Stark manages to break out a window and seek cover long enough to change into Iron Man.

As Iron Man, Stark battles the Maggia and Gladiator, and saves Janice and Vincent from a falling trap, however his hands are crushed in the rescue attempt. Battling the Gladiator again, Iron Man is losing the battle until he tries to gain the upper hand by using his repulsor rays, however in attempting to do so Iron Man is shocked to find that they were damaged when he was trying to save Janice and Vincent, leaving him at the mercy of the Gladiator's whirling blades.
name: The Maggia Strikes

description: How will the JSA deal with their family connection to Manhunter?
name: Psychobabble, Part Two: Mind Over Morals

description: As the trial of Dr. Psycho takes an unexpected turn, a long-lost troublemaker steps back through cyberspace!
name: Psychobabble, Part Three: Ghost in the Machine

description: Manhunter makes her peace with the past and discovers her true abilities, even as a new villain cuts a swath through L.A.!
name: Psychobabble, Part Four: Phantom Pain

description: Manhunter and Dr. Psycho throw down! Will the VILLAINS UNITED mastermind break her, or make her trophy wall?
name: Psychobabble, Part Five: Can't Get You Out A My Head

description:
1. Cover by Keith Giffen and Bob Oksner.
  2. "Black Beauty or 'A Horse is a Horse, of Course, of Course'" written by Robert Loren Fleming and Keith Giffen, penciled by Keith Giffen, inked by Bob Oksner, colored by Anthony Tollin and lettered by John Costanza. (Ambush Bug and Superman)
  3. "Mr. Mxyzptlk, Media Star!" written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Alex Saviuk, inked by Dennis Jensen, colored by Anthony Tollin and lettered by Ben Oda. (Mxy with Superman, Lois Lane, Perry White, Jimmy Olsen, Lana Lang, Morgan Edge, Josh Coyle)
  4. "Jimmy Olsen -- Blob!" written by Craig Boldman, penciled by Howard Bender, inked by Pablo Marcos, colored by Anthony Tollin and lettered by Milt Snapinn. (Jimmy Olsen as The Blob, Superman, Lois Lane)

Obviously Ambush Bug was gaining popularity considering he is back in only 3 issues. A more rare thing back in the day.

The book opens with Irwin Schwab repairing his teleportation bugs. when they explode causing him to change color, and discover he no longer needs the mechanical bugs to teleport. While he is trying to find help he accidentally comes across Superman, who is trying to get a burglar to prison. Joining Superman at the Jailhouse, Ambush Bug recants his origin story. Ambush Bug was from another planet, and right before it exploded he was sent to Earth by his dying parents.
name: Black Beauty or 'A Horse is a Horse, of Course, of Course / Mr. Mxyzptlk, Media Star!  / Jimmy Olsen -- Blob!

description: The solo adventures of Kate Spencer come to a stunning conclusion - but her new life as a dark hero has only just begun! Final issue.
name: Two Superheroes and A Fed Walk Into A Bar...

description:
1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "Their Magnetic Majesties--King Alexander and Queen Bee!" written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.

"Queen Bee plus King Alexander equals a royal pain for Superman!"
name: Their Magnetic Majesties--King Alexander and Queen Bee!

description:
1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "The Great Toyman Trivia Contest!" written by Paul Kupperberg, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger, inked by Dennis Jensen, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Albert De Guzman. (Superman vs. Toyman, with Lana Lang and Josh Coyle)
  3. "The Past and Future Superman!" written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled by Wayne Boring, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Todd Klein. (featuring Superman, Superboy, Clark Kent, Lana Lang and Zatara)

"The Toyman declares war on Superman : Extra! Wayne Boring returns with 'The Past and Future Superman!'"
name: The Great Toyman Trivia Contest! / The Past and Future Superman!

description:
1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "The Once-and-Future Peri(l)" written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Milt Snapinn.
  3. "A Superman of a Different Color!" written by Paul Kupperberg, penciled by Alex Saviuk, inked by Dennis Jensen, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Phil Felix.

Notes:
name: The Once-and-Future Peri(l) / A Superman of a Different Color!

description:
While Iron Man fights the Gladiator to protect Janice Cord, Whitney Frost attacks Stark Industries to still all of Tony Stark's high tech weapons! Will she succeed? Find out in this action-packed issue!

As Iron Man is busy fighting the Gladiator in order to save Janice Cord and her lawyer Vincent Sandhurst, Whitney Frost and her Maggia goons knock out the SHIELD agents assigned to protect Stark Industries so that they can steal high tech weapons. Whitney struggles over her feelings towards Jasper, while she reflects on how she came to be the head of the Maggia. How when she reached the age of adulthood her true father Count Nefaria revealed his identity to her and forced her into training to become a Maggia agent and eventually installing her as Big M.

Meanwhile, Iron Man manages to fight off Gladiator who retreats from battle to join the rest of the Maggia at Stark Industries. Following with Janice and Vincent, Iron Man confronts the invaders and is aided by the timely arrival of Jasper and reinforcement SHIELD agents. During the course of the battle, most of the Maggia agents and the Gladiator are captured, however Jasper cannot bring himself to stop Whitney from escaping due to his feelings towards her.
name: A Duel Must End!

description:
Riddler tries to piece together "who Batman is?"!

Riddler will put together a series of challenges that will tell him who Batman is!

So...he`ll probably have to stop the Prince of puzzles before he finds out, eh?
name: Who is Batman?!?

description:
Reprints Avengers #6 from July 1964

We outdid ourselves in this issue! You're going to see more super heroes and more super-villains than ever in this action-packed, feature-length thriller introducing Zemo and his Masters of Evil! Caution! Don't tear this magazine or wrinkle the pages or get food stains on it. We have a hunch you'll want to save it as a collector's item for a long, long time! Reprinting The Avengers #6 by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby, with an ALL-NEW story by Dwayne McDuffie (FANTASTIC FOUR) and Michael Avon Oeming (POWERS).
name: Masters of Evil!; Stings

description:
Introducing: Batgirl! Barbara Gordon hits the streets of Gotham City, fighting for justice and keeping her secret alter ego hidden from her father, Police Commissioner James Gordon.

#18 of Batman Strikes adds Batgirl. Batgirl is obsessed with Batman, so she decides to become his unofficial sidekick. This will either spell trouble for Batman, or give an end to Poison ivy's green house plant!
name: The Greenhouse effect

description:
1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "The All-Searing Eyes!" written by Bob Rozakis, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Milt Snapinn. Superman's heat vision is out of control.
  3. "Hoax Night!" written by Paul Kupperberg, penciled by Howard Bender, inked by Dennis Jensen, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda. Superman vs a long imprisoned druid.

Notes:

  • Elastic Lad cameo flashback.
name: The All-Searing Eyes! / Hoax Night!

description:
1. Do You Make Life Hard for Yourself? (public service message) -- 2. Luthor's First Victory Over Superman! (Superman vs Lex Luthor and Brainiac, with Lois Lane, Perry White, Jimmy Olsen, Ardora, and President Lyndon B. Johnson / written by Leo Dorfman) -- 3. The Prize of Peril (Supergirl wins Miss Universe, but did she win a booby-prize?, Dick Malverne / written by Otto Binder) -- 4. Cap's Hobby Center (by Henry Boltinoff)

Lex Luthor (intercom transmission): Luthor calling Superman!... Are you chicken? Brainiac and I will fight you at high noon. You've trained long enough on our wooden dummies. It's time for the main event!

"Extra! Supergirl enters the Miss Universe Beauty Contest and wins--'The Prize of peril'"
name: Luthor's First Victory Over Superman!  ;  The Prize of Peril

description:
1. Block Heads (Foghorn Leghorn, Henery Hawk) -- 2. Touchdown Tweety (Sylvester, Tweety, Granny) -- 3. Produckt Placement (Daffy Duck) -- 4. Mars Needs Dogs (Charlie Dog, Marvin the Martian) -- 5. Glide Control (Wile E. Coyote and Roadrunner)

Foghorn Leghorn: Where'd yuh go, son? Aintcha gonna catch me?
name: Block Heads

description:
1. Femme Fatale (Bugs Bunny, Taz the Tasmanian Devil) -- 2. Missing Link (Bugs Bunny) -- 3. Stiff Upper Beak (Daffy Duck) -- 4. For My Sweet Tea (Daffy Duck, Bugs Bunny, Taz) -- 5. Old Dawg New Tricks (Foghorn Leghorn, Barnyard Dawg)

Bugs Bunny (inside Taz's mouth, pulling on his uvula): Whaddaya know... The light does go on when I pull the string!
name: Femme Fatale

description:
1. "Home Sweet Home!" public service ad.
  2. "The Menace from the Stars!" (Superman) written by Unknown, penciled by Wayne Boring and inked by Stan Kaye. Superman stops an asteroid on a collision course with Earth - but Kryptonite in the asteroid's make-up leave him with amnesia, and the effects of the asteroid are far from over on Earth too!
  3. "Nine Men against Fort Mohawk!" (Tomahawk & Dan Hunter) written by Unknown, penciled by and inked by Nick Cardy.
  4. "Shorty" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  5. "The Mystery of the Vanishing Villains!" (Green Arrow & Speedy) written by Unknown, penciled and inked by George Papp.
  6. "Little Pete" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  7. "Rockin' th' Ranchers!" (Two-Gun Percy) written by Unknown, penciled and inked by Jimmy Thompson.
  8. "Riddle of the Portuguese Cat!" (Danger Trail) written by Dave Wood, penciled by Carmine Infantino and inked by Howard Sherman.
  9. "Caging the King of the Beasts" two page text piece by Jack Mabely.
  10. "The Secret Weapons of the Crimesmith!" (Batman & Robin vs The Crimesmith) written by Unknown, penciled by Shelly Moldoff and inked by Charles Paris.

Notes:

  • To this day, the writer of the classic Superman story The Menace from the Stars remains unknown.
  • Tomahawk story takes place in 1776.
  • Flash Bulb Arrows, Silk Thread Arrows and Jack-in-the-Box Arrow used.
name: The Menace from the Stars! / Nine Men against Fort Mohawk! / The Mystery of the Vanishing Villains! / Rockin' th' Ranchers! / Riddle of the Portuguese Cat! / The Secret Weapons of the Crimesmith!

description:
1. "Jor-El's Last Will" (Superman) written by William Woolfolk.
  2. "Shorty" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  3. "The Junior Ghost Patrol" (Tomahawk) written by Dave Wood.
  4. "The Matador with a Bow" (Green Arrow)
  5. "Sudden Death Valley" (Two-Gun Percy)
  6. "The Seven Hills of Rome" (Danger Trail) written by Dave Wood.
  7. "Amazing Creatures of the Amazon" full text factual article by Jack Miller.
  8. "Start the Day Off Right" (public service message by Buzzy) written by Jack Schiff.
  9. "The Man Who Wanted to Die with Batman" (Batman & Robin) written by Bill Finger.

"Save your money here : best guarded bank in the world"

Overview:

Hey, look! In the great Marvel tradition comes a brand-spankin'-new holiday special with three premiere stories. Industry Legend Tom Defalco (Spider-Girl) brings you a riff (and a GREAT story!) on A Christmas Carol, starring J. Jonah Jamison and Spider-Man with "ghost-of-Crhistmas" appearances by Captain America and the Thing. Rising star Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa (MK Four, Nightcrawler) writes two mini-holiday tales, one featuring a Hanukkah story with Ben Grimm (The Ever-Lovin' Blue-Eyed Thing)! 48 PGS./ALL AGES. FURTHER COMMENTS FROM LONE STAR'S AARON SETTLE: Marvel's Holiday Special is one of the most fun books I've read in a while. The first story features the Fantastic Four investigating why the Moloids have been kidnapping Santas from around the city. Mike Perkins provides very cool art for Mike Carey's "Christmas Day in Manhattan" which once again stars the Fantastic Four. But the highlight of the book has to be Jeff Parker's "Yes, Virginia, There is a Santatron". This fun story sees the New Avengers squaring off against a Santa robot and ends with a great speech about the season from Captain America.

Story List:

  1. Jonah's Holiday Carol
  2. An X-Men X-Mas
  3. The True Meaning of...
name: Jonah's Holiday Carol / An X-Men X-Mas / The True Meaning of...

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: "3 hilarious Tom & Jerry stories!"
name: Tom Vs. Robo-Rover!

description: The devastating view of a post-apocalyptic WildStorm Universe continues as Maximum Man witnesses what becomes of his beloved town. But are things as bad for a city populated almost entirely by Super-Heroes as they are for the rest of the world? And if not, won't others come looking to take Tranquility's resources for themselves?
name: A Quiet Little Town

description:
1. "Lois Lane's Plot Against Lana Lang!" (Lois Lane, Lana Lang, Superboy, Professor Potter). Written by Unknown, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  2. "Peg" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
  3. "Lois Lane's Luckiest Day!" (Lois Lane, Perry White, Shrinking Violet, Triplet Girl & Lightning Lass). Written by Unknown, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger. Reprinted in The Best of DC #44.
  4. "The Prophecy of the Oracle Bird!" (Lois Lane, Superman, Lana Lang, Lucy Lane). Written by Unknown, penciled by John Forte and inked by George Klein.

Notes:

  • In the story "Lois Lane's Plot Against Lana Lang!" it shows that Smallville has a Superboy Museum. Groucho Marx, Bob Hope, Jimmy Durante, Jerry Lewis and Maynard G. Krebs (Bob Denver) appear as robotic toys. It is the Christmas season in Smallville.
  • In the story "Lois Lane's Luckiest Day!" the Legionnaires Lightning Lad, Lightning Lass, Star Boy and Matter-Eater Lad appear as holograms in Lois Lane's earrings. Lois Lane is volunteering as a nurse at the Metropolis Hospital. Perry White appears on a television screen as he is being viewed from the 30th Century talking to Lois Lane.

Cover: Lois Lane (thought): Her I am back in time, in Smallville, when Lana Lang first met Superman...as a boy! he's about to ask her for a new Year's Eve date...But I've got a scheme that will wreck their romance before it ever starts!
name: Lois Lane's Plot Against Lana Lang! / Lois Lane's Luckiest Day! / The Prophecy of the Oracle Bird!

description:
1. Cover by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  2. A three part imaginary story written by Unknown, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger.
  3. "The Terrible Secret of Mrs. Lois Superman!" (The Three Wives of Superman! part 1)
  4. "The Tragic Torment of Mrs. Lana Superman!" (The Three Wives of Superman! part 2)
  5. "The Shocking Fate of Mrs. Lori Superman!" (The Three Wives of Superman! part 3)

Reprinted in The Superman Family #164 & DC's Greatest Imaginary Stories #1.

"The most amazing imaginary novel of all time!"

Superman (thought): The three girls I loved the most... each died after I married her... I've lost them forever!
name: The Three Wives of Superman!

description:
1. "The Battle of the Atoms" (Superman vs Lex Luthor, with Lois Lane, Perry White / written by Don Cameron) Clark and Lois drive into the countryside looking for the source of a 'terrific upheaval'. They discover massive trees bent over, boulders melted and steel structures twisted. Upon further investigation they come across some of Luthor's thugs. Learning that Superman is close to discovering his plot, Luthor launches an immediate attack on the Daily Planet with his latest weapon - a powerful Atomic Beam! Reprinted in Superman #243.
  2. "The Bad Old Knights" (Superman goes to Camelot in a dream / written by Bill Finger)
  3. Daffy and Doodle (gag strip by Lit Win)
  4. "Gun-Grabbing George" (full text story by Jack Miller)
  5. Jasper (gag strip by Lit Win)
  6. "The International Swindler" (Lois Lane, Clark Kent, Perry / written by Whitney Ellsworth)
  7. "The Man of Stone" (Superman vs Goon McGloon, with Lois, Perry / written by Don Cameron)

The main story The Battle of the Atoms was censored by the U.S. government. It wasn't released until after WWII concluded.
name: Battle of the Atoms!

description: The explosive conclusion of "Crossfire and Collateral," the most skin-crawling EXTERMINATORS arc yet! Henry and Stretch must form an unlikely alliance with the drug kingpin Otiz to have any hope of escaping the Mayan Hisser onslaught. But under the command of Henry's resurrected partner, CJ, the Hisser army will stop at nothing to win.
name: Crossfire And Collateral - Chapter Five

description:
1. Cover by Jack Burnley and Stan Kaye.
  2. "The Big Superman Broadcast!" written by Don Cameron, penciled by Joe Shuster and inked by George Roussos. (Superman on the radio, with Lois Lane)
  3. " Scuffy the Tramp" gag strip by Lit Win.
  4. "The Monster of China Deep!" written by Don Cameron, penciled by Ira Yarbrough and inked by Stan Kaye. (Superman vs Captain Spears, with Lois)
  5. " Little Brother" gag strip by Phil Berube.
  6. "Picture Frame" 2 page text story by Fred Whitby.
  7. "The Fake Pendant" A "Lois Lane Girl Reporter" story written by Whitney Ellsworth, penciled and inked by Sam Citron. (Lois Lane, Clark Kent)
  8. "Swindle in Sweethearts!" written by Don Cameron, penciled by Ira Yarbrough and inked by Stan Kaye. (Superman, Lois Lane, Wilbur Wolfingham )
name: The Big Superman Broadcast! / The Monster of China Deep! / Swindle in Sweethearts!

description:
1. When Superboy was a Superbaby (Superboy, Superbaby Ma Kent, Pa Kent / written by Bill Finger)
  2. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  3. The Flags of Crime! (Superboy vs Humpty Dumpty the Hobby Robber / written by Bill Finger)
  4. Home, Sweet Home! (public service message by Binky)
  5. Shutter Bugs (camera article)
  6. Ready to Go (full text article)
  7. Daffy & Doodle (gag strip by Lit Win)
  8. Shorty (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  9. The Boy Without a World! (Superboy / written by Ed Hamilton)
  10. Whistling Lariat (Superboy's Workshop)

Superboy: Yum Yum -- I see you've got blueberry pie for dessert, mother!

Ma Kent: Oh dear! With your X-ray vision, I can't keep any surprises from you, son!

1. Superboy's Man of Steel! (Superboy vs Sir Percy the Robot/ written by Ed Hamilton) -- 2. The Boy Who Stole a Brain! (Superboy / written by Bill Finger) -- 3. Balance Your Fun Diet (public service message by Buzzy / written by Jack Schiff)) -- 4. Casey the Cop (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 5. Winner Take All No.3 (ful ltext article) -- 6. Little Morton (gag strip drawn by Phil Berube) -- 7. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 8. Ship Ahoy, Superboy! (Superboy vs Humpty Dumpty the Hobby Robber) -- 9. Code Machine (Superboy's Workshop)
name: Another Adventure of Humpty-Dumpty the Hobby Robber

description: Solomon Grundy smashes things on Monday! The first time we saw Grundy, he was really Clayface, but Batman's about to find out that the legend of the swamp monster is very, very real!
name: Born on a Monday

description:
In the blue corner, the caped crusader...protector of Gotham...Baaaaaat-MAAAAAN!!!!

In the red corner, the Mexican steroid wrestler...the man who wants to break the bat...BAAANEEE!!!!!
name: 20. Title Card - Batman vs. Bane

description: When Firefly and Mr. Freeze put Batman on ice--literally--it's up to Batgirl to save the day in her first solo adventure.
name: The Burning Cold : Hot Time in the City!

description: It's a race against time for Batman when Gearhead comes back to town! Will Gearhead's control over all vehicles allow him to take over the Batmobile and the streets of Gotham? It's going to be a high-speed demolition derby through the city!
name: Demolition

description: Batman's having a very, very rough night. It's bad enough Man-Bat is running riot through the skies of Gotham City - it's worse when Batgirl is attached to the flying monster!
name: Learning to Fly : Chaos Over Gotham!

description: It's a wild night in Gotham City! Batman and Batgirl know that Catwoman's planning to steal a priceless piece of art. But can they keep an eye on her when some of Gotham's most dangerous criminals are loose?
name: Waiting to Pounce

description: Killer Croc has spent his life being kept in cages. Now he's broken free, and only the Batman can keep Croc from taking an explosive revenge on all of Gotham City!
name: Behind Bars

description: When is a Catwoman not a thief? When she's been hired by a bank to test their security, that's when. But when Bruce Wayne finds out about the bank's shady dealings, only Batman save Catwoman from a trap that even she can't escape!
name: Once a Thief...

description: The Ultimates are now international celebrities, but fame isn't all it's cracked up to be! Beseiged by emergencies, the team discovers how they fit into Tony Stark's plans -- as their many mysteries are revealed!
name: Giant Man Vs. The Wasp

description: With their ranks thinned, Nick Fury is forced to enlist new superhumans into The Ultimates! But how will the team -- and the world -- react to Hawkeye, Quicksilver, the Scarlet Witch and the Black Widow?
name: Homeland Security

description: First issue.

Yaar! Keep yer tongue behind your teeth and listen up, ya landlubber! As hapless Kinneas flees for his life, the pirates and ninjas are in hot pursuit, both groups eager for revenge. All that's sparing Kinneas from their immediate wrath is that he's on the verge of finding an even greater treasure, and ninja and pirate alike are out to gain it first! Of course, with the treasure being firmly inland, the ninjas have a distinct advantage—or DID until now. Determined not to let his silent, sinister adversary Ryusei gain the upper hand, Captain Mako takes his crew where no pirate has gone before—across the ground on a Land Boat! A grand adventure indeed, not to be missed less'n you want a marlin-spike 'round yer loaf!

1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto.
  2. "The Artistic Thefts of Terra-Man!" written by Paul Kupperberg, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda. Superman vs Terra Man, who steals some Rembrandt paintings.
  3. "Yesterday Once More!" written by Bob Rozakis, penciled by Howard Bender, inked by Dave Hunt, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Bob Lappan. Superman tries to solve a 7 year old murder.

Notes:
name: The Artistic Thefts of Terra-Man! / Yesterday Once More

description:
1. Cover by Eduardo Barreto and Klaus Janson.
  2. "Endings" written by Marv Wolfman, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Kurt Schaffenberger, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Ben Oda.

Notes:

  • The Superman Robots are a creation of Vandal Savage.
  • The Galaxy Communications Building was called the Daily Planet.
name: Endings

description:
1. Superman's Million-Dollar Photos! (Superman vs Isaah Pendleton) -- 2. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 3. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. The Hidden City! (Congo Bill / written by Jack Miller) -- 5. Give Your Pet All the Breaks! (public service message by Binky / written by Jack Schiff) -- 6. The Cosmic Jigsaw Puzzle! (Tommy Tomorrow vs Eldred Tharn) -- 7. The Treasure of Get-Rich Creek! (Vigilante vs Mr. Deems)

Isaah: What am I offered for this album of Superman photos?

Man: I bid $1,000,000!
name: Superman's Million-Dollar Photos!

description: Scorpion allies himself with Shao Kahn while Kintaro captures Sonya.
name: No Guts, No Glory

description:
1. Smoking is for Squares! (public service message / written by Jack Schiff) -- 2. Lois Lane's Pen-Pal Romance! (Lois Lane, Superman, Perry White) -- 3. Honey in Hollywood (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. Lois Lane's Love Trap! (Lois, Superman) -- 5. The Lois Lane - Lana Lang Truce! (Lois, Lana Lang, Superman, Perry, Superman Revenge Squad, Medusa) -- 6. Lois Lane's Time Trips (full text article by E. Nelson Bridwell)

Lois Lane: Lana, since Superman met that space-girl, he hardly knows we're alive! We must do something! We can't let him marry her!

Lana Lang: Right, Lois! We'll declare a truce to our rivalry, until we get rid of this common enemy!
name: The Truce Between Lois Lane and Lana Lang!

description: 1. The Two Faces of Superman (Superman) -- 2. The Racketeer's Revenge (Casebook Mystery) -- 3. The Joust of Jeopardy (Green Arrow) -- 4. The Tale of A Cat (Jimminy and Magic Book / by Howie Post) -- 5. The Burning of Bonnville (Tomahawk / written by Dave Wood) -- 6. A Day in the Life of a Paratrooper -- 7. The Crime Consultant (Batman & Robin)
name: Shoe Shines

description: What is the meaning of life? Why are we here? Is there a God? Who would win in a fight, pirates or ninjas? Since time immemorial man has pondered these cosmic questions. It is no secret that pirates and ninjas have always been at odds. At long last, two of history's most formidable opponents in physical combat will meet on the field of destiny for the ultimate showdown. Throughout the millennia, these natural enemies have left death and despair in their wake. Now, they face each other to battle for supremacy. The burning question will finally be answered in this genocidal free-for-all. Let the greatest battle of all time commence!

1. "The Mxyztplk-Susie Alliance!" (Superman vs. Mr. Mxyzptlk and Susie Tompkins, with Lois Lane) written by Don Cameron, penciled and inked by Ira Yarbrough. Reprinted in Limited Collectors' Edition #38 & Superman in the Forties.
  2. "There is No Superman" (Prof. Whiffensniff believes that Superman is a hoax, with Lois and Perry White / written by Jerry Siegel) reprinted in Superman #246.
  3. "Jasper" gag strip by Lit. Win.
  4. "One in a Million" full text story by Ed Blaney.
  5. "The Silken Mystery" (Lois Lane, Clark Kent) written by Whitney Ellsworth.
  6. "A Modern Marco Polo" (Superman, Lois Perry, Kublai Khan) written by Don Cameron.

"When impish Susie and super-impish Mr. Mxyzptlk form an alliance, it's a super-headache for Superman!
name: The Mxyztplk-Susie Alliance! / There is No Superman / A Modern Marco Polo

description:
1. The Heroes' Club! (Superboy / written by Bill Finger) -- 2. The Puppet That Came to Life! (Superboy) -- 3. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. Peg (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 5. Hail to a New Caesar! (full text biography of Sid Caesar) -- 6. Little Arhtur's Scramble Squares (puzzle page) -- 7. How to Bring Christmas Cheer (public service message by Superboy / written by Jack Schiff)-- 8. Superboy's Problem Parents! (Ma and Pa Kent switch roles / written by William Woolfolk) -- 9. Build a Rotoship! (Superboy's Workshop)

"3 smash adventures starring the Boy of Steel"
name: The Heroes' Club!

description: Scarface has a new puppet master(?) The Joker!
name: The Comic and the Straight Man : Joker's Got a New Toy ... And It's Scarface!

description: Introducing...Robin! The Dark Knight's newest partner must join forces with Batgirl to protect Gotham City without Batman at his side. The young'uns will need all their training and instincts if Gotham's going to stand a chance!
name: While the Bat's Away : Robin Hits the Scene!

description: When a squad of high-tech art thieves hit Gotham Museum, only Batman and Alfred can stop this. However, will it be in time before Catwoman finds out that there is a priceless artifact? The answer will be solved here!
name: Young at Art : The Chase Is on!

description: "Guest starring Spike 'n' Tyke!"
name: Grudge Match on Center Court

description:
Bugs goes to the roller derby! Taz goes into big business! And Porky tries to lose weight!

  1. Roll Out the Bunny (Bugs Bunny)
  2. A Latte For Nothing (Bugs Bunny, Elmer Fudd)
  3. Takin Care of Business (Taz, the Tasmanian Devil)
  4. The Predator Group (Bugs Bunny, Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd, Wile E. Coyote, Yosemite Sam, Sylvester
  5. All's Wieght That Ends Weight (Porky Pig, Daffy Duck)

Daffy Duck: Hey, Bugs! Wanna see my new puppy?

Bugs Bunny: Er...

name: Days of Thunder, Nights of Pain

description: In a new storyline the sensational she-cow finds herself the center of a showdown between the finest representatives of both sexes. Adding to the confusion are all those other cows who escaped last issue.
name: Armed Camps

description: In Hearts and Minds classic super-good guys Captain Academia and Hollowpoint decide the fate of the Crime Cannibal and he's not gonna be happy about their decision! How's the Cow fit in?
name: Hearts And Minds

description: In this free-standing and free-wheeling installment MECow encounters serious trouble when she runs into alien invaders from space who have come to Earth... to steal cattle!?
name: The Day The Herd Stood Still!

description: Sweet Heather the Crime Cannibal's girl friend has to babysit at a spooky old house near a graveyard. And it's Halloween! The kid needs an exorcist... and as The City's protector as appointed by The Tick it's up to Man-Eating Cow to save the day!
name: A Spooky House on a Hill Near a Graveyard

description: Paul continues his fight against The Detroit Fury a metal monster created by a disgruntled American autoworker and THE MITI MEN a super-'hero' group sent from Japan to protect Japanese interests from the Detroit Fury's attacks!
name: Some Posturing & Lots Of Fighting!
Rising Son

description: Paul taking a part time job as a night watchman only to stumble into the clutches of a mysterious villain! This issue has a guest appearance of the Tick!
name: Boiler Men: Boiler Menace!

deck: One-shot from Event Comics featuring Painkiller Jane and Darkchylde
description: In a bleak dreamscape, a sword-wielding barbarian naked V'Ark is kidnapping women from the waking world to serve as part of his harem. Painkiller Jane is asked to investigate a hypnotherapist specializing in sleep disorders after his patients begin lapsing into comas, Meanwhile, 18-year old Ariel Chylde is drawn into the Nightmare Realm, where both she and Jane become prisoners of the deviant predator and his monstrous minions. Another power watches from the shadows, with its own designs for the two anti-heroines as well as for the Nightmare Realm.
name: Lost In A Dream

volume.name: Painkiller Jane / Darkchylde: "Lost in a Dream"

description: Guest-starring Nick Fury! S.H.I.E.L.D.¹s elite black-ops team closes in on taking down the mindless body of Deathlok, which is wreaking havok up and down the Vegas strip! Meanwhile, young Billy Bailey must sneak across state lines to retrieve his original, cyborg form! Only one man stands between the destruction of the world¹s ultimate military machine and the life of an innocent boy, and his name is Nick Fury!
name: The Crawl Part Two: Thrill-Kill Confidential

description: Batman is trying to find out about a kidnapping, however the police think he's the kidnapper. The truth is, "he is the kidnapper." With the mysterious mind binder Spellbounder in his head, no one in Gotham City is safe! The Dark Knight must find Spellbounder and put a stop to the madness.
name: An Hour of your Time
The Killing Fields and The Gift

description: How do you kill what can not be killed? How do you catch what can not be caught? These are the questions the nigh-unkillable pirates and extremely sneaky ninja camps begin to ask as they face down their newfound adversaries while trying to make their way to each other's ancient treasures! Cutlasses or caltrops? Tattoos or tonfa? Who will reign supreme?

name: Death Moves and Every Dog Has Its Day

description: The eternal enmity of pirates and ninjas escalates into raw, animal fury! That's right, this time it's parrot vs. monkey! Natural companions of pirates and ninjas, respectively, these two fierce creatures are rarely found together in the wild for long, for whenever they meet, blood is spilled in a fight to the death! So when a swashbuckling, sea-faring Caribbean pirate's parrot meets a sword-slinging, samurai-slaying Japanese ninja's monkey in the middle of Venice during the Napoleonic wars, it is clear that there can be no survivors!
Paul encounters the forces that caused the mysterious disappearances of all the other security guards. This story gets real hot!
name: Revolt

description: Down and out Paul is at his lowest ebb. Can Vernon Coop get him out of this funk and who has suddenly made a miraculous reappearance into Paul's life?
name: Wretched
Just Tell Them Paul the Samurai Sent You

description: Paul continues his fight against The Detroit Fury a metal monster created by a disgruntled American autoworker and THE MITI MEN a super-'hero' group sent from Japan to protect Japanese interests from the Detroit Fury's attacks!
name: Blue Hawaii, White Death

description: After so many missions and lose of memory, Aphrodite IX is finally going to know the truth of her missions and who her creators are, but, is she ready to face the truth?
Paul's gigantic battle with Gomorra leads him to the real criminal mastermind behind all the mischief: the very UNdead Sagin the Wolf!
name: With Brothers Like These . . .

description: This issue is part 1 of the 'Crisis on Finite Tick Spin-Offs'! This is the first installment of The Tick's ONLY crossover story. Thrill to the action as The Tick - Cow - Paul and various other super-heroes confront a galaxy of super-bad-guys who are in league with none other than the resurrected Sagin the Wolf!
name: A Heroic Fist-o-Thon
